Climate disasters become very unlikely with a probability below 0.5 percent. Initial probability not stated but is inferred as 9% given the final value of <0.5%.
They typically last several decades and reduce aggregate consumption by much more than one third.

Generations born 150 years from now gain about 2 percent in certainty equivalence with a 20% fixed tax rate. Assuming this benefit is realised after a lifespan of around 70 years, this translates to around the year 2171.

Climate disaster probability is reduced from more than 5 percent to around 2.5 percent with a 20% fixed tax rate. This outcome is reported as negative since the change is a reduction, affecting outcomes around 500 years into the future.
Optimal fixed tax rate on dirty energy is 20 percent, which is 5% lower than the one found for the case of no climate uncertainty, at the current period (2021).
